results.definition: a person who is of equal standing with another in a group

examples: let them match their best athletes against ours

results.definition: be equal to in quality or ability
examples: Her persistence and ambition only matches that of her parents

results.definition: lighter consisting of a thin piece of wood or cardboard tipped with combustible chemical; ignites with friction
examples: he always carries matches to light his pipe

results.definition: a pair of people who live together
make equal, uniform, corresponding, or matching
examples: The company matched the discount policy of its competitors

results.definition: bring two objects, ideas, or people together
examples: Matchmaker, can you match my daughter with a nice young man?

results.definition: a person regarded as a good matrimonial prospect

examples: when a match is found an entry is made in the notebook

results.definition: be compatible, similar or consistent; coincide in their characteristics
examples: The suspect's fingerprints don't match those on the gun

results.definition: a burning piece of wood or cardboard
examples: if you drop a match in there the whole place will explode

results.definition: a formal contest in which two or more persons or teams compete

examples: The company matched the employees' contributions

results.definition: something that resembles or harmonizes with
examples: that tie makes a good match with your jacket

results.definition: the score needed to win a match
